sen.e: Gasho (887 - February 20, 967) was a monk of Tendai Sect who was active in the Middle of Heian Period.

sen.j: 長年宮中で内供奉を務め、天徳 (日本)4年（960年）に内裏が焼失した直後には毘沙門天を修するなど功績も多く、康保2年（965年）には権律師・法性寺座主に、翌年には律師に任じられたため「護念院律師」とも称された。
sen.e: As he achieved a lot of results while he served as naigubu (a special monk who holds a position in the Imperial court) for long, such as the restoration of Bishamonten Statue after Dairi Palace was destroyed by fire in 960, he was appointed in 965 to Gon-risshi・head priest of Hossho-ji Temple and risshi in the following year and therefore, he was also called "Gonen-in risshi".

sen.j: ところが、天台座主の地位を25歳年下の良源と争うが敗れ、その衝撃で病に倒れて僧綱の記録によれば康保4年1月9日に81歳で没したとされている。
sen.e: However, he was defeated by Ryogen, who was younger than him by 25 years, when the two monks competed each other for the position of Tendai Zasu (Head Priest of Enryaku-ji Temple) and due to subsequent shock, he fell ill and, according to the record of Sogo, died on January 9, 967 at the age of 81.

sen.j: そのため、死後には怨霊になって良源を保護していた藤原北家九条流に祟ったと言われ、『小右記』長和5年5月7日 (旧暦)（1015年5月27日）条には、当時の三条天皇（九条流藤原兼家の外孫）の眼病は藤原元方と賀静の怨霊によるものであると記されている。
sen.e: After his death, therefore, it was believed that he damned Kujo school of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan as a vengeful spirit and in the clause of May 27, 1015 of "Shoyu-ki Diary", it is recorded that the eye disease of the then Sanjo Emperor (a grandchild born of a daughter of Kujo school FUJIWARA no Kaneie) was caused by vengeful spirits of FUJIWARA no Motokata and Gasho.
